name: Epoxidharzklebstoff (Artikel 420597, 419368)
hazard_category: Epoxy resin adhesive; causes skin and eye irritation, skin sensitisation, toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
hazards_description: Classified as skin irritant and causing serious eye irritation (Skin Irrit. 2, H315; Eye Irrit. 2, H319), and as skin sensitiser that can cause allergic skin reactions (Skin Sens. 1, H317).[attached_file:file:3] Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects (Aquatic Chronic 2, H411); contains epoxy resin components such as 2,2-bis(4-(2,3-epoxy-propoxy)-phenyl)-propan and other epoxy oligomers that can trigger sensitisation, especially with repeated skin contact.[attached_file:file:3]
protective_measures: Use only in well-ventilated areas or with local exhaust; avoid inhaling vapours or aerosols and avoid contact with skin and eyes.[attached_file:file:3] Keep containers tightly closed, store cool and dry in original packaging, and keep away from food, beverages and feed; remove contaminated clothing immediately and apply preventive skin protection (protective creams) where appropriate.[attached_file:file:3] Wear suitable chemical-resistant protective gloves (e.g. butyl rubber, nitrile or chloroprene with sufficient breakthrough time), tightly fitting safety goggles and protective work clothing when handling the resin.[attached_file:file:3]
emergency_procedures: In case of accidental release, provide adequate ventilation, avoid inhalation of vapours or aerosols, and use suitable respiratory protection if ventilation is insufficient.[attached_file:file:3] Do not allow product to enter soil, drains, surface or groundwater; contain spillage with absorbent material (e.g. sand, universal binder, sawdust) and transfer to suitable labelled containers for disposal.[attached_file:file:3] Contaminated wash water and collected waste must be disposed of according to official regulations and must not be discharged into the sewer system.[attached_file:file:3]
emergency_phone_reference: Giftnotdienst der Charité Universitätsmedizin Berlin, 24h: +49 (30) 30 68 67 00; betriebliche Notrufnummer siehe Aushang.[attached_file:file:3]

first_aid.hautkontakt: Mit Produkt verunreinigte Kleidungsstücke unverzüglich entfernen; betroffene Hautpartien sofort mit viel Wasser und Seife waschen und gründlich nachspülen; bei andauernder Hautreizung oder allergischen Reaktionen Arzt aufsuchen.[attached_file:file:3]
first_aid.augenkontakt: Augen bei geöffnetem Lidspalt mehrere Minuten unter fließendem Wasser spülen, dabei Kontaktlinsen möglichst entfernen; bei anhaltenden Beschwerden Augenarzt konsultieren.[attached_file:file:3]
first_aid.verschlucken: Mund ausspülen und reichlich Wasser nachtrinken; bei Beschwerden oder Unsicherheit ärztlichen Rat einholen, keine größeren Mengen ohne medizinische Beurteilung aufnehmen.[attached_file:file:3]
first_aid.einatmen: Betroffene Person an die frische Luft bringen und ruhig lagern; bei Atembeschwerden oder Unwohlsein sicherheitshalber Arzt aufsuchen; bei Bewusstlosigkeit stabile Seitenlage und sofort medizinische Hilfe veranlassen.[attached_file:file:3]

first_aider_reference: Ersthelfer sollen geeignete persönliche Schutzausrüstung tragen; bei Verdacht auf allergische Reaktion, Atemstörungen oder anhaltende Beschwerden immer umgehend ärztliche Hilfe hinzuziehen.[attached_file:file:3]
disposal: Do not dispose of with household waste and do not allow to reach the sewer system; waste and contaminated absorbents must be handled as hazardous waste according to local and national regulations.[attached_file:file:3] Contaminated, uncleaned packaging should be optimally emptied and, after appropriate cleaning (e.g. with alcohol or acetone), supplied to recycling where possible; contaminated packaging must be treated like the product.[attached_file:file:3]
